repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - National Pension Administration
            Technical Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The National Pension Administration
            Technical Project had a satisfactory outcome, likely
            sustainability, high institutional development impact, and
            satisfactory performances by both Bank and Borrower.
            Political and macroeconomic instability affected the
            project.  The following lessons were learned: A key factor
            to ensure sustainability is the continuity of reform-minded
            administrators. The departure of 'champions'
            endangers the sustainability of modernization processes.
            Finding adequate mechanisms to ensure sustainability has to
            be a priority at the onset of the modernization process.
            Distinguish between modernization and anti-corruption
            efforts when tackling an agency's overhaul.  Accurately
            diagnose corruption before embarking on a full-fledged
            anticorruption campaign.  Different strategies exist with
            respect to agency modernization. Use of consultants brings a
            danger of generating a dependency or resistance on the part
            of the bureaucracy.  Identify measurable landmarks to
            demonstrate the progress made and ensure its sustainability.
            Purposely encouraging bottom-up participation can foster
            innovation, enhance ownership and strengthen sustainability.
            Building a direct relation with the public can help top
            agency managers   Rotating managers among the various
            divisions can help management develop a more holistic
            understanding of the overall agency  Public agencies can
            play an important role in revitalizing their constituencies.
            Losing focus becomes a challenge in institutional
            development projects with a longer life span.  Maintaining
            the impetus of modernization efforts remains a challenge,
            particularly when reaching performance thresholds.
            Distinguish between potential and actual savings when
            designing monitoring and impact indicators

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - National Pension Administration
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the National Pension
            Administration Technical Assistance Project are to assist
            the National Social Security Administration (ANSeS) in
            improving its institutional efficiency and effectiveness
            along modern management principles in order to (1) reduce
            instances of improper pension payment, (2) improve the
            quality of its client services, and (3) absorb the
            administration of the provincial pension funds. The project
            will be implemented over a four-year period. It will finance
            technical assistance, consulting firms and the acquisition
            of computer equipment, through five components. Activities
            in the fraud and error component aim to reduce unwarranted
            disbursements by desk-checking existing paper files,
            carrying out on-site visits, and updating the beneficiary
            database. The second component aims to reorganize agencies
            to provide one-stop, full-service points of sale, while the
            remaining components focus on institutional strengthening
            which introduces a new organizational structure, management
            techniques, and incentives linked to performance; on project
            administration with key personnel and accounting and
            monitoring systems Bank-financed; and lastly, on the
            absorption into the national system of 22 provincial pension
            funds, after their files are verified and screened for
            errors and fraud.
